- **Joint likelihood of data set**:
$\Lik \eqdef \p(\vY= \vy, \vD = \vd | \mX = \mx)$

- **Marginal likelihood contribution of obs. *i* **: 
$\Lik_i \eqdef \p(Y_i= y_i, D_i = d_i | \vX_i = \vx_i)$

*By the Independent Observations Assumption:*

$$
\ba
\Lik &= \prod_{i=1}^n \Lik_i
\ea
$$
*Non-Informative Censoring Assumption:* 
$T_i\ind C_i | \vX_i$

*By the Non-Informative Censoring Assumption:*

$$
\ba
\Lik_i &\propto [\pdf_T(y_i|\vx_i)]^{d_i} [\surv_T(y_i | \vx_i)]^{1-d_i}
\\
&= \surv_T(y_i|\vx_i) \cdot [\haz_T(y_i|\vx_i)]^{d_i}
\ea
$$

Mathematical properties of time-to-event probability distribution functions:

- **Survival function**:
$\surv(t | \vx) \eqdef \P(T > t|\vX = \vx) = \int_{u=t}^{\infty} \pdf(u|\vx)du = \expf{-\cuhaz(t|\vx)}$

- **Probability density function**:
$\pdf(t| \vx) \eqdef \p(T=t|\vX = \vx) = -S'(t|\vx) = \haz(t| \vx) \Surv(t | \vx)$

- **Cumulative hazard function**:
$\cuhaz(t | \vx) \eqdef \int_{u=0}^t \haz(u|\vx)du = -\logf{\surv(t|\vx)}$

- **Hazard function**: $\haz(t |\vx) \eqdef \p(T=t|T\ge t,\vX = \vx) = -S'(t|\vx) = \frac{\pdf(t|\vx)}{\surv(t|\vx)}$

*By the Proportional Hazards Assumption:*

$$
\ba
\haz(t |\vx) &= \haz_0(t) \cdot \theta(\vx)
\\
\cuhaz(t |\vx) &= \cuhaz_0(t) \cdot \theta(\vx)
\ea
$$


*By the Logarithmic Link Function Assumption:*

- **Link function**: $\logf{\theta(\vx)} = \diffloghaz(\vx)$

- **Inverse link function**: $\theta(\vx) = \expf{\diffloghaz(\vx)}$

**Linear Predictor Component**: 
$\loghaz(t|\vx) \eqdef \logf{\lambda(t|\vx)} = \loghaz_0(t) + \diffloghaz(t|\vx)$

*By the Linear Predictor Component Functional Form Assumption:*

$$\diffloghaz(t|\vx) = \vx \cdot \vb \eqdef \beta_1 x_1 + \cdots + \beta_p x_p$$
